text.title: Albanian oil magnate ready to pay Silvio Berlusconi €700m for AC Milan

main.p: Albanian oil magnate Rezart Taci says he would have "no problem" in paying €700million (£647m) to buy AC Milan if owner Silvio Berlusconi decides to sell.

Speculation that Berlusconi will sell has increased since a Milan administrative court ruled the Italian premier's holding company, Fininvest, must pay €750m to rival CIR for bribing a judge in a 1990s battle to buy Italy's biggest publisher Mondadori. Fininvest has repeatedly denied Berlusconi has any intention to sell
Talking to La Gazzetta dello Sport, Taci said: "My group is used to taking on big commitments and seeing them through to the end. I'm sure I can find the necessary financing."
The €700m figure matches analysts' valuation of seven-times European champions Milan, who are struggling to find form. Taci said he had already spoken to Berlusconi about buying the club.

"He told me that he does not intend to sell, but I know that if he decided to, he would take my proposal into consideration. I guarantee that I would do everything to keep Milan where they deserve to be – at the top of the world."
Taci admitted that his bid to buy Serie A side Bologna in the close season fell through because his hopes were raised that he might be able to buy Milan instead.
"As a Milan fan I thought it was best to be patient for a little while," he said. "Why kid people of Bologna if there was the chance a bigger door would open in the meantime?"
